subject: Programming
title: Code Smells
description: A quick win: understand Code Smells.

hook.text: You can't always prove code is bad, but you can smell it. Something just feels off.

buildup.text: Martin Fowler coined 'code smell' ‚Äî surface signs that usually indicate deeper problems.

discovery.text: Long methods, duplicated logic, and excessive comments are classic smells that signal trouble.

twist.text: A smell isn't a bug. The code works fine. But it's harder to change, test, and understand.

climax.text: Learning to smell bad code is the first step. The fix is refactoring ‚Äî restructuring without changing behavior.

punchline.text: If the code smells, it's time to clean up.
